sub_title: Advisor, speaker and author at Transparency Challenge Foundation and Foundation PIN
summary:
Stichting Transparency Challenge: Founder and President, May 2010 - Present
Stichting Platform Initiatief Noordwijk: Founder an President, May 2015 - Present
Stichting Liberale Kring Noordwijk: Founder  and President, March 2011 - Present
Stol Consult: President, April 1986 - Januari 2019
Tilburg University: Research Associate, February 2010 - February 2015
Super Collect b.v.: Founder and President, May 2000 - November 2010
Super Collect Patent b.v.: President, March 2002 - November 2010
Technical University Delft: Information manager 1995 - 1997 
Statistics Netherlands: Head Automation Department (ICT and organisation): 1990 - 1994
Orga-Info Nederland b.v. : President, October 1981 - April 1986
NMB (currently ING group): ICT database specialist, September 1979 - October 1981
EHLB (insurance company): assistent to Board of Directors ICT and organisation 1977 - 1979
Technical University Delft: assistent to Prof. B.K. Brussaard (IS, Faculty Mathematics) 1976 - 1977

projects.title: E-Core project Slovenia
projects.description: Architect and responsible partner for ICT in a consortium of the E-Core project. This project aimed at lowering the administrative burden by the use of ICT in Slovenia.

projects.title: DATAMED project
projects.description: Management consultant of the project manager (ISTAT). Objective of the project: use of ICT in data capture on very small enterprises in Meditarrean coutries (IT, PT, GR, ES).

contributors.headline: Advisor, speaker and author at Transparency Challenge Foundation and Foundation PIN

projects.title: TELER (Telematics for Enterprise Reporting)
projects.description: Architect of the project that successfully demonstrated that by direct extraction of data from the enterprises information systems the administrative burden on the enterprises - due to statistical data capture - can be lesseened with 85%. Project manager of the activities of the 8 participating National Statistical Institutes, with demonstrations in 73 enterprises, spread over 8 countries. Member of Management Board, Technical Board and Editorial Board.

company.name: Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek and Stol Consult

profile_positions.company: Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek and Stol Consult
profile_positions.description:
Hans Stol was a speaker at many conferences on ICT, Statistics and Evidence based policymaking. Examples are:
Helsinki, 1996, ISI, Teler project; Ljubljana, 2005, SORS (Statistical Office of Slovenia), E-Core project; Ljubljana, 2002, SORS, Metadata in data capture; Prague, 1999, ETK (Exchange of technology and Knowledge);  Kreta, 2001, ETK/NTTS, SuperCollect software for electronic data collection; Luxembourg, NTTS, Eurostat; Brussels, 2011, Eurostat, Statistics and Transparency; Paris, 1994 - 1996, Eurostat, Teler; London, 2003, ASC, SuperCollect; Athens, 2012, Eurostat, An European architecture of Statistical Information systems;  Rome, ISTAT, 1999, Teler; Rome, ISTAT, 2000 , Datamed; Rome, ISTAT, 2003 , Codacmos; Rome,  ISTAT, 2005 , Euroky-PIA; Napels, NTTS, 1996; Teler; Cairo, 2010, CAPMAS (Egyptian Bureau of Statistics), Policymaking, measuring facts and statistics; Amman, 2010, Palestine Bureau of Statistics, Contribution of statistics in transparency in policymaking; Tilburg, 2009 - 2015, University, Evidence based policymaking and knowledge management; Amsterdam, 1993 , VU, information planning; Amsterdam, 1990 , UVA, design of databases; Delft, 1980-1989 , information planning and design of information systems;
profile_positions.title: Speaker and author

profile_positions.description:
The foundation "Transparency Challenge" aims at reaching the following goals:
Improving the transparency in the policy making process by emphasizing (1) the need for defining measurable objectives in the policy making process, (2) an effective realisation of these objectives and (3) a verifiable and reliable justification of the realisation of the objectives.
The foundation wants to reach these goals by: (1) organizing seminars and congresses, (2) the publication of articles and (3) disseminating the goals at seminars and congresses.
profile_positions.title: President and founder

profile_positions.description: Evidence-based policy making, Information Technology & Organisation consultancy, Organisation and Architecture of Statistical Systems.
profile_positions.title: President, Founder and Senior consultant

profile_positions.description: Tilburg Center for Cognition and Communication.

profile_positions.description: Owner of a patent for electronic data capture via Internet, by linking automated administrative systems of suppliers of data to electronic questionnaires provided by data collectors (for example Statistical Offices).
profile_positions.title: President and founder

profile_positions.description: Development and exploitation of software systems for electronic data capture via Internet.
profile_positions.title: President and founder

profile_positions.description: Special appointment with focus on control structure, administrative and management information systems
profile_positions.title: Information Manager

profile_positions.description: Design of the information architecture (1986-1991) and the development of the organisation of the IT function (1991-1995). From 1990 to 1994 head of the ICT department of the CBS, during this period also responsible for the reorganisation of the IT function in the other parts of CBS.
profile_positions.title: Head of the ICT division

profile_positions.description:
Developer of the AMBI module information systems: S4. 
Trainer of professionals in the theory and practice of the development of information systems.
Developer of exams and examiner.
profile_positions.title: Developer, trainer and examiner Informationsystems (AMBI S4)

profile_positions.description: High level consultancy on architecture, design and implementation of information systems. Government and big companies.
